item.description:
join us for a weekly walk around the pond when you can.

update 2/3

I just wanted to add a few comments. I was very encouraged by our HUGE group last week... but it was also a bit overwhelming! in a good way!

I know its a bit corny, but since we are still getting to know one another i will do an attendance for all that reply yes for the meet up. that being said, as a general note, if you know you can't make it, please make every effort to change your response. I do look at the website right before i leave the house. I would hate to wait for some one who isn't coming, and leave someone who is late. and please forgive me, i'm really bad at names!

Also, with such a variety of dogs, some of us walk faster/slower than others. I would like to maintain a consistant pace, but don't want anyone to have a hard time keeping up. If you know you will be slower, please let us know and we can match you with a buddy. I don't want anyone walking alone, it defeats the purpose of having such a great big group!

Also, we will try to keep the loop going, walking around twice, straight through. this comes back to slower/faster walkers. maybe we can find a happy medium that everyone is comfortable with? as always if you have time constraints, just let us know and we'll see you off!

I know some folks wanted to take advantage of some of the off the trail trails. for the most part, izzy and i will be walking the regular loop, but feel free to take advantage of the parks offerings. I just don't want anyone off on their own!

if anyone has any questions or comments, please feel free to comment! this is designed to be a "group effort" and if you have an idea just put it out there.

we'll see everyone sunday, and i know we didn't get to it, but there is a coffe shop close by so speak up and let me know if you want to head that way. I'm pretty easy going, i just want iz to have her friends!
item.how_to_find_us: people with dogs will find each other, scent, sight or sound

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Livingston Park/ Dorrs Pond
